intro: Cochlearia officinalis var. danica, commonly known as Danish cochlearia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches a height of about 15–30 centimeters. The plant features basal leaves that are broadly ovate to elliptic in shape, with a hairy texture. Its flowers are small, yellow, and arranged in a raceme, blooming from late spring to early summer. It is native to coastal areas of northern Europe and is often found in sandy or calcareous soils.
